definitions: relating to Uruguay or its people, culture, or language
examples: The Uruguayan soccer team won the championship
She learned about Uruguayan traditions from her grandmother

definitions: relating to or aiming for a perfect society where everything works harmoniously
having unrealistic or impractical ideas about achieving perfection in social or political matters
examples: The novel described a utopian community without poverty
They lived in a utopian settlement based on equality
His utopian dreams ignored practical economic constraints
The politician's utopian promises seemed impossible to fulfill

definitions: relating to Uzbekistan or its people, culture, or language
examples: The Uzbekistani embassy hosted a cultural festival
She studied Uzbekistani art and architecture in college

definitions: relating to the Vedas, the oldest sacred texts of Hinduism, or the period when they were composed
examples: Students analyzed Vedic hymns in their Sanskrit class
The Vedic period shaped many Hindu religious practices

definitions: relating to Venice in Italy or its people, culture, architecture, or distinctive style
examples: The Venetian glass was beautifully hand-blown and colorful
They stayed in a Venetian palace overlooking the canal

definitions: relating to Venezuela or its people, culture, or language
examples: The Venezuelan artist displayed her paintings downtown
They served traditional Venezuelan arepas at the festival

definitions: relating to the reign of Queen Victoria (1837-1901) or the art, culture, and attitudes of that period
having attitudes or values considered typical of the Victorian era, especially being very strict about moral behavior
examples: The Victorian mansion had ornate wooden trim
She collected Victorian furniture and decorative objects
His Victorian attitudes about propriety seemed outdated
The school had Victorian rules about student behavior

definitions: relating to Vienna, the capital of Austria, or its people, culture, music, or cuisine
examples: The Viennese waltz requires elegant, flowing movements
They enjoyed Viennese coffee and pastries every morning

definitions: relating to Vietnam or its people, culture, or language
examples: The Vietnamese restaurant served authentic pho soup
She studied Vietnamese history during the war period

definitions: describing a computer display that shows text and graphics exactly as they will appear when printed
examples: The wysiwyg editor made website design much easier
Modern word processors use wysiwyg interfaces for documents

definitions: relating to the German composer Richard Wagner or his dramatic operatic style
having qualities of grandeur, intensity, or dramatic power reminiscent of Wagner's operas
examples: The Wagnerian opera lasted over four hours
She studied Wagnerian themes in her music theory class
The storm had an almost Wagnerian intensity
His Wagnerian ambitions required massive resources to achieve

definitions: relating to Washington D.C., the capital of the United States, or its residents
relating to the state of Washington in the Pacific Northwest or its residents
examples: The Washingtonian magazine covers local D.C. politics
Many Washingtonian professionals work in government agencies
The Washingtonian climate features mild, rainy winters
Washingtonian coffee culture rivals that of Seattle

definitions: relating to Wales or its people, culture, or Celtic language
examples: The Welsh choir sang traditional folk songs
She studied Welsh mythology and ancient Celtic legends

definitions: relating to John Wesley, founder of Methodism, or his religious teachings
relating to the Wesleyan branch of Methodism or institutions named after Wesley
examples: The Wesleyan doctrine emphasized personal holiness
He studied Wesleyan theology at the seminary
She attended Wesleyan University in Connecticut
The Wesleyan chapel held services every Sunday

definitions: relating to Wicca, a modern pagan religion incorporating witchcraft and nature worship
examples: The Wiccan ceremony celebrated the summer solstice
She studied Wiccan beliefs about nature and spirituality

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the northern United States, especially New England
relating to Americans in general, as viewed by people from other countries
examples: The Yankee accent was distinctly different from Southern drawls
They served traditional Yankee pot roast for dinner
The Yankee tourists stood out in the European city
Foreign newspapers often use Yankee to mean American

definitions: relating to Yemen or its people, culture, or Arabic dialect
examples: The Yemeni coffee had a distinctive, rich flavor
She wore traditional Yemeni jewelry to the wedding

definitions: relating to the former country of Yugoslavia or its people, cultures, or languages
examples: The Yugoslav embassy closed after the country dissolved
His Yugoslav passport became invalid in the 1990s

definitions: relating to the former country of Yugoslavia or its people, cultures, or languages
examples: The Yugoslavian basketball team was highly successful
She collected Yugoslavian stamps before the country split

definitions: relating to Zambia or its people, culture, or languages
examples: The Zambian copper mines employ thousands of workers
They learned about Zambian wildlife conservation efforts

definitions: relating to Zimbabwe or its people, culture, or languages
examples: The Zimbabwean sculpture exhibition attracted many visitors
She studied Zimbabwean history during the colonial period

definitions: relating to or supporting Zionism, the movement for establishing and developing a Jewish nation in Israel
examples: The Zionist movement gained momentum after World War II
She studied Zionist literature from the early 20th century

definitions: relating to Zoroastrianism, an ancient Persian religion founded by Zoroaster based on worship of Ahura Mazda
examples: The Zoroastrian fire temple maintained an eternal flame
They studied Zoroastrian influences on other major religions

definitions: left empty or deserted by people who previously occupied or used it
having been given up, discontinued, or left behind without inhibition or restraint
examples: The abandoned building had broken windows and graffiti
They explored the abandoned mining town in the desert
She danced with abandoned joy at the celebration
His abandoned attempts at learning piano gathered dust

definitions: shortened by omitting letters or words while retaining the essential meaning
examples: The abbreviated version saved space in the document
Students used abbreviated notes during the fast-paced lecture

definitions: relating to the abdomen, the part of the body containing the stomach and other digestive organs
examples: The patient experienced severe abdominal pain after eating
Regular abdominal exercises strengthen your core muscles

definitions: engaged in the act of taking someone away illegally by force or deception
examples: The abducting suspect was caught on security cameras
Police investigated reports of someone abducting pets from yards

definitions: departing from an accepted standard or normal type; showing abnormal or atypical behavior
examples: The scientist studied aberrant cell growth in tumors
His aberrant behavior at work concerned his colleagues

definitions: inspiring disgust and loathing; completely opposed to one's values or morals
examples: Most people find cruelty to animals absolutely abhorrent
The abhorrent conditions in the prison sparked public outrage

definitions: continuing without change; enduring for a long time or permanently
examples: She had an abiding love for classical music
His abiding faith helped him through difficult times

definitions: extremely unpleasant and degrading; existing in the worst possible conditions
completely without pride or dignity; showing submission or hopelessness
examples: They lived in abject poverty without basic necessities
The documentary revealed abject living conditions in slums
He offered an abject apology for his mistakes
Her abject surrender surprised everyone who knew her

definitions: burning fiercely with large flames consuming something
very brightly lit, colored, or glowing as if on fire
examples: The building was ablaze before firefighters arrived
The dry forest was ablaze within minutes
The autumn trees were ablaze with red and orange
Her eyes were ablaze with excitement and determination

definitions: deviating from what is normal, average, or expected; unusual in a problematic way
examples: The doctor noticed abnormal test results requiring further investigation
His abnormal reaction to the medication concerned the nurses

definitions: causing moral revulsion; very bad or unpleasant; deserving strong condemnation
examples: The abominable treatment of prisoners violated human rights
The food at that restaurant was absolutely abominable

definitions: indigenous or native to a place from the earliest times
relating to the Aboriginal peoples of Australia or their languages and cultures
examples: The museum displayed aboriginal art and artifacts
They studied aboriginal plants used for medicine
The Aboriginal community celebrated their traditional festival
She learned about Aboriginal dreamtime stories and beliefs

definitions: failing to produce the intended result; unsuccessful or fruitless in achieving goals
examples: Their abortive attempt to climb the mountain ended in retreat
The abortive peace talks left both sides frustrated

definitions: existing, occurring, or situated above the surface of the ground
examples: The aboveground pool was easier to install than digging
Most aboveground utilities are vulnerable to weather damage

definitions: capable of polishing or cleaning a hard surface by rubbing or grinding
showing little concern for others' feelings; harsh or rough in manner
examples: The abrasive cleaner removed stubborn stains effectively
Sandpaper uses abrasive particles to smooth wood
His abrasive personality made him unpopular at work
Her abrasive comments hurt several people's feelings

definitions: side by side and facing the same way
up to date with the latest news, developments, or information
examples: The soldiers marched four abreast down the street
Two horses ran abreast toward the finish line
She kept abreast of current events through daily reading
Staying abreast of technology changes requires constant learning

definitions: shortened by condensing or rewriting while preserving the basic contents and meaning
examples: The abridged dictionary was perfect for traveling students
Children often start with abridged versions of classic novels

definitions: sudden and unexpected; happening quickly without warning or preparation
brief to the point of rudeness; curt or brusque in speech or manner
examples: The car made an abrupt stop at the red light
His abrupt departure from the company surprised everyone
Her abrupt response made it clear she was annoyed
The manager's abrupt manner intimidated new employees

definitions: not present in a place where one is expected to be
showing a lack of attention or awareness; preoccupied or distracted
examples: Three students were absent from class due to illness
The absent manager left her assistant in charge
He had an absent expression during the long meeting
Her absent response showed she wasn't really listening

definitions: relating to the principle that something is absolute and not admitting of any exception or qualification
examples: His absolutist views on morality left no room for compromise
The absolutist ruler demanded complete obedience from subjects

definitions: freed from blame, guilt, responsibility, or the consequences of an action
examples: The jury absolved him of all criminal charges
She felt absolved after confessing her mistakes

definitions: having taken in or soaked up liquid or other substance
deeply engaged or interested; giving all one's attention to something
examples: The absorbed water made the sponge heavy
All the spilled milk was absorbed by paper towels
She was so absorbed in her book she missed her stop
The absorbed students didn't hear the bell ring

definitions: able to soak up liquid easily through pores or spaces in the material
examples: These absorbent towels can hold twice their weight in water
The absorbent material prevented spills from spreading

definitions: intensely interesting or engaging; capable of holding one's complete attention
examples: The absorbing mystery novel kept her awake all night
He found quantum physics an absorbing subject to study

definitions: showing a lack of attention to what is happening; preoccupied or lost in thought
considered apart from concrete existence or a specific example; theoretical
examples: He had an abstracted air while pondering the problem
Her abstracted manner worried her usually attentive friends
The abstracted concept was difficult for students to grasp
They discussed abstracted theories rather than practical applications

definitions: wildly unreasonable, illogical, or inappropriate; deserving of ridicule
examples: The absurd price for a simple sandwich shocked customers
His absurd excuse for being late made everyone laugh

definitions: existing or available in large quantities; more than enough; plentiful
examples: The garden produced abundant tomatoes this summer season
Natural resources were abundant in the unexplored region
